_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  Facility Policy.  The owners, management and employees of the City of Newton's Mission Water Treatment Plant are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of chlorine.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, the Harvey County LEPC,  and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impact of the release to the public and the environment.



2.  Facility Information.  The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of drinking water to the community.



3.  Accidental Release Prevention Program.  The City of Newton abidies by all pertinent State of Kansas Regulations related to chlorine and to guard against accidental releases of chlorine at the water treatment plant.  If a release should occur, we will notify all applicable response agencies to minimize the harm to the surrounding community and the environment.



4.  Five-Year Accident History.  There have been no accidental releases of chlorine during the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.



5.  Emergency Response Program.  The facility has an Emergency Action Plan.  We do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.  If a major release of chlorine takes place at our facility, the response action is to evacuate the area of the release and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers.



6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  Safety improvement is an ongoing process at this facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to access the conditions of the facility.  There are no major improvements planned in the area of safety at this time.
